ingredients: [{"ingredients":"450g rhubarb , trimmed and cut into chunks"},{"ingredients":"85g caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"roughly a 500g/1lb 2oz tub or can ready-made custard"},{"ingredients":"½ quantity honey crunch granola (see 'Goes well with')"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"First make the Honey crunch granola with almonds & apricots (see 'Goes well with'). You'll need half the granola for this recipe."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat oven to 150C/130C fan/gas 2. Arrange the rhubarb in a roasting tin just big enough to hold it all in a single layer, scatter with the sugar and cover with foil. Bake for 15-20 mins until just tender, then cool in the tin."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Spoon a little rhubarb into the base of 6 glasses or pots, then top with a couple of tbsp custard. Sprinkle over some granola, then repeat the layers to fill the glasses."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 onions, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves, crushed"},{"ingredients":"¼ tsp hot chilli powder"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp ras el hanout"},{"ingredients":"1 butternut squash, peeled and cut into 2cm pieces"},{"ingredients":"100g red lentils"},{"ingredients":"1l hot vegetable stock"},{"ingredients":"1 small bunch coriander, leaves chopped, plus extra to serve"},{"ingredients":"dukkah (see tip) and natural yogurt, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large flameproof casserole dish or saucepan over a medium-high heat. Fry the onions with a pinch of salt for 7 mins, or until softened and just caramelised. Add the garlic, chilli and ras el hanout, and cook for 1 min more."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Stir in the squash and lentils. Pour over the stock and season to taste. Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer and cook, covered, for 25 mins or until the squash is soft. Blitz the soup with a stick blender until smooth, then season to taste. To freeze, leave to cool completely and transfer to large freezerproof bags."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Stir in the coriander leaves and ladle the soup into bowls. Serve topped with the dukkah, yogurt and extra coriander leaves."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"175g light muscovado sugar"},{"ingredients":"175ml sunflower oil"},{"ingredients":"3 large eggs, lightly beaten"},{"ingredients":"140g grated carrot (about 3 medium)"},{"ingredients":"100g raisins"},{"ingredients":"1 large orange, zested"},{"ingredients":"175g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp bicarbonate of soda"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp ground cinnamon"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp grated nutmeg (freshly grated will give you the best flavour)"},{"ingredients":"175g icing sugar"},{"ingredients":"1½-2 tbsp orange juice"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Oil and line the base and sides of an 18cm square cake tin with baking parchment."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Tip the sugar, sunflower oil and eggs into a big mixing bowl. Lightly mix with a wooden spoon. Stir in the carrots, raisins and orange zest."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Sift the flour, bicarbonate of soda, cinnamon and nutmeg into the bowl. Mix everything together, the mixture will be soft and almost runny."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Pour the mixture into the prepared tin and bake for 40-45 mins or until it feels firm and springy when you press it in the centre."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Cool in the tin for 5 mins, then turn it out, peel off the paper and cool on a wire rack. (You can freeze the cake at this point if you want to serve it at a later date.)"},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"Beat the icing sugar and orange juice in a small bowl until smooth – you want the icing about as runny as single cream. Put the cake on a serving plate and boldly drizzle the icing back and forth in diagonal lines over the top, letting it drip down the sides."}]

recipe: Honey crunch granola with almonds & apricots
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"200g clear honey"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp mild-flavoured oil , such as sunflower or rapeseed"},{"ingredients":"300g rolled oats"},{"ingredients":"100g whole unblanched almonds"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp ground cinnamon"},{"ingredients":"140g dried apricots , roughly chopped"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. In a large pan, heat the honey and oil together until bubbling, then tip in the oats, almonds and cinnamon. Stir well until the oats are well coated, then tip onto 1-2 large baking sheets, spreading the mixture out. Bake for 20-25 mins, stirring halfway, until golden."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Remove from the oven and, while still hot, stir in the apricots. Spread out again and press down with a spatula to cool – this will help it to clump together. Once cool, serve with yogurt or milk, and fruit, if you like. Will keep in an airtight container for 3 weeks. See 'Goes well with' for recipes using your granola."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"little oil, for the tin"},{"ingredients":"170g pack sage & onion stuffing mix (we used Paxo)"},{"ingredients":"500g pack diced pork shoulder"},{"ingredients":"300g pig liver"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp ground mace"},{"ingredients":"2 onions, thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp sunflower oil"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp sugar"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp red wine vinegar"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp plain flour"},{"ingredients":"850ml beef stock"},{"ingredients":"handful chopped parsley"},{"ingredients":"mash and veg, to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 160C/140C fan/gas 3. Lightly oil a very large roasting tin. Tip the stuffing mix into a large bowl, add 500ml boiling water, stir and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pulse the pork in a food processor until finely chopped. Add the liver and pulse again. Add to the stuffing with the mace, 1 tsp salt and plenty of black pepper. Stir well. Shape the mixture (it will be very soft) into 24 large faggots and put in the prepared tin."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"To make the gravy, fry the onions in the oil until starting to turn golden. Add the sugar and continue cooking, stirring frequently, until caramelised. Tip in the vinegar and allow to sizzle. Mix the flour with a couple of tbsp water. Pour the stock into the onions, then add the flour paste and cook, stirring constantly, until smooth and starting to thicken. When it is thick, pour into the tin with the faggots, cover with foil and bake for 1 hr until cooked through. Serve sprinkled with parsley, with mash and a veg, if you like."}]

recipe: Chilli bean bake with soured cream mash
name: Chilli bean bake with soured cream mash

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"50g butter"},{"ingredients":"50g clear honey"},{"ingredients":"½ quantity honey crunch granola (see 'Goes well with')"},{"ingredients":"100g plain chocolate , half chopped into small chunks, half melted"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"First make the Honey crunch granola with almonds & apricots (see 'Goes well with'). You'll need half the granola for this recipe."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat oven to 190C/170C fan/gas 5 and line a baking tin (15 x 20cm, or 18cm square) with baking parchment. Melt the butter and honey together in a large pan. Stir in the granola and chocolate chunks, making sure they are all well coated."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Tip the flapjack mix into the tin and press down very firmly (a potato masher is a good tool to use here). Cover with foil or more baking parchment, then bake for 25-30 mins. Leave to cool in the tin, then drizzle over the melted chocolate. Once set, cut into 8 portions. Can be stored in an airtight container for 3 days."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"4 skinless chicken breasts , chopped into chunks"},{"ingredients":"4 skinless, boneless chicken thighs , chopped into chunks"},{"ingredients":"2 onions , sliced"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp curry paste (we used korma and tikka masala)"},{"ingredients":"300g cauliflower , chopped into small florets"},{"ingredients":"700ml chicken stock"},{"ingredients":"400g can chopped tomato"},{"ingredients":"400g can chickpea , rinsed and drained"},{"ingredients":"200g natural yogurt"},{"ingredients":"300g spinach"},{"ingredients":"400g basmati rice , cooked following pack instructions"},{"ingredients":"5 tbsp flaked almond"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Start by making the curry. Heat 1 tbsp of the oil in a large, deep frying pan. Season the chicken and fry until browned, then remove and set aside. Fry the onion in the rest of the oil for 10-12 mins until soft and starting to caramelise."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the paste and cauliflower, stirring to coat everything, then return the chicken. Pour in the stock, tomatoes and chickpeas and simmer everything for 30 mins until the cauliflower is nearly tender. There should be just enough liquid to cover everything so add a splash more water or stock if you need to. Remove from the heat and stir in the yogurt."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Assemble the bake in either 1 large or 2 smaller, deep ovenproof dishes. Start with a ¹/³ of the spinach leaves, season, then top with a ¹/³ of the curry. Finish with a ¹/³ of the rice then repeat twice more. Scatter on the almonds and either cool completely to freeze, or heat oven to 220C/200C fan/gas 7 and cook for 20-25 mins until the topping has crisped up and the dish is piping hot through."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"3 aubergines , sliced lengthways"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"3 large garlic cloves , crushed"},{"ingredients":"680ml jar passata"},{"ingredients":"½ tbsp dried oregano"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp sugar"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp red wine vinegar"},{"ingredients":"small bunch basil leaves , torn"},{"ingredients":"100g parmesan , or vegetarian alternative, grated"},{"ingredients":"125g ball mozzarella , torn"},{"ingredients":"200g fresh lasagne sheets"},{"ingredients":"5 tbsp breadcrumb"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat grill to high. Arrange the aubergine slices on a baking sheet, brush with oil and season well. Grill for 2-3 mins each side until golden brown, set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat oil in a saucepan. Fry the garlic for 1 min then pour in the passata. Simmer for 10 mins with the oregano, sugar and vinegar, then season and stir in the basil."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Assemble the lasagne in a roughly A4-sized baking dish. Spread a few tbsp of the tomato sauce over the base of the dish, followed by a layer of aubergine. Scatter over some Parmesan and mozzarella, then cover with a layer of lasagne. Repeat, finishing with a topping of Parmesan and mozzarella, and sprinkle on the breadcrumbs."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Allow to cool at this point for freezing, or heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6 and cook the lasagne for 25-30 mins until golden and bubbling."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"½ quantity beef with red wine & carrots (see 'Goes well with')"},{"ingredients":"400g can chopped tomato"},{"ingredients":"500g pappardelle pasta"},{"ingredients":"grated parmesan , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"First make the Beef with red wine & carrots (see 'Goes well with'). You will need half the finished stew for this recipe."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Put the stew in a large pan and use 2 forks to roughly shred the beef. Add the tomatoes, bring to a simmer, then gently cook for 15 mins. Meanwhile, cook the pasta."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Spoon some sauce onto each portion of pasta, or stir through and top with Parmesan to serve."}]

recipe: Cinnamon pancakes with compote & maple syrup
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"140g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp ground cinnamon"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp muscovado sugar or brown sugar"},{"ingredients":"1 large egg"},{"ingredients":"300ml milk"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp vanilla extract"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp melted butter , plus extra for frying"},{"ingredients":"½ quantity apple , pear & cherry compote, to serve (see 'Goes well with')"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"First make the Apple, pear & cherry compote (see 'Goes well with'). You'll need half the compote for this recipe."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, cinnamon, sugar and ½ tsp salt. In a jug, whisk the egg, milk, vanilla and melted butter. Make a well in the dry ingredients and pour in the milk mixture gradually, whisking as you go to make a smooth batter. Ideally, let the mixture stand for 1 hr (or even overnight, covered in the fridge), although you can cook with it straight away."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Heat a non-stick frying pan over a medium-high heat. Melt a knob of butter, then drop in tbsps of the mixture to make pancakes about 10cm across. Cook for 2-3 mins until bubbles appear on the surface, then flip over and cook for 1 min more. Keep each batch warm while you use up the rest of the batter. Stack up the pancakes and serve with hot or cold compote, maple syrup and yogurt."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 red onion , sliced"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves"},{"ingredients":"2 large aubergines , cut into 1.5cm pieces"},{"ingredients":"3 courgettes , halved and cut into 2cm pieces"},{"ingredients":"3 mixed peppers , cut into 2cm pieces"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp tomato purée"},{"ingredients":"6 large ripe tomatoes , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"small bunch of basil , roughly chopped, plus a few extra leaves to serve"},{"ingredients":"few thyme sprigs"},{"ingredients":"400g can plum tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp red wine vinegar"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp brown sugar"},{"ingredients":"sourdough , to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large frying pan and fry the onion for 8 mins until translucent. Add the garlic and fry for 1 min. Turn the heat to medium-high, add the aubergines and fry for 5 mins until golden. Stir in the courgettes and peppers and fry for 5 mins more until slightly soft. Add the tomato purée, fresh tomatoes, herbs, canned tomatoes, vinegar, sugar and 1 tsp salt and bring to the boil."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Transfer to the slow cooker and cook on low for 5-6 hours or until everything is soft and the sauce has thickened. Season, scatter over some extra basil, and serve with sourdough, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 ¼kg lean beef mince"},{"ingredients":"1 onion , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"140g breadcrumb"},{"ingredients":"100g mature  cheddar , grated"},{"ingredients":"small bunch parsley , chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce"},{"ingredients":"1 egg , lightly beaten with a fork"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp mild chilli powder"},{"ingredients":"2 ½kg bag of  potato , cut into chunky chips"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp plain flour"},{"ingredients":"10 tsp olive or  sunflower oil"},{"ingredients":"burger buns , lettuce, sliced red onion, tomatoes, gherkins, and sauces or relishes, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Tip the mince into a large bowl with the onion, breadcrumbs, cheese, parsley, Worcestershire sauce, egg, chilli powder, ½ tsp salt and some pepper. Mix together well with your hands, then divide the mixture into 10 and shape into burgers."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Bring 2 large saucepans of water to the boil (or prepare the chips in batches if you don’t have enough big pans). Add the chips, bring the water back to the boil and set your timer for 3 mins. After 3 mins, drain the potatoes well and tip onto one or two large kitchen-papercovered trays. Scatter with the flour and some seasoning and gently toss to coat."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Freeze the burgers and chips (see freezing tips, below) or, to cook straight away, heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. In a baking tray, toss the chips in a little oil, then roast for 35-40 mins until crisp and golden. Meanwhile, heat a griddle pan, grill or barbecue until hot, then cook the burgers for about 5-8 mins on each side, or until cooked to your liking. Sandwich the burgers in toasted buns with salad and sauces, then serve with the chips."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"3 tbsp vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"1 ½kg stewing or braising steak, cut into small chunks"},{"ingredients":"2 large onions, chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 carrots, chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 celery stalks, chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 bay leaves"},{"ingredients":"2 thyme sprigs or rosemary sprigs"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp plain flour"},{"ingredients":"750ml bottle red wine"},{"ingredients":"1 beef stock cube"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp tomato purée"},{"ingredients":"100g unsmoked bacon lardons"},{"ingredients":"6 small shallots or baby onions, halved or quartered"},{"ingredients":"300g closed cup mushrooms, halved or quartered"},{"ingredients":"mashed potatoes or crusty bread, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Turn the slow cooker to low and heat 2 tbsp of the oil in a large frying pan. Season the meat and fry for 3-4 mins in batches until browned all over, scooping out each batch with a slotted spoon and transferring the browned meat to a plate."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Tip the onion, carrot and celery into the pan and fry for 5-10 mins until soft. Add the herbs and flour and cook for another 2 mins. Pour a splash of the wine into a bowl, then add the stock cube, sugar and tomato purée and mix to form a paste. Scrape the paste into the onion mix and pour in the remaining wine. Bring the mixture to a bubble, then transfer to the slow cooker. Stir in the browned beef, topping up with a splash of water to cover the meat if needed. Simmer on low for 6-8 hrs until the meat is falling apart but still holding its shape."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"About 35 mins before serving, heat the remaining oil in a pan. Fry the bacon, shallots and mushrooms for 5-8 mins until caramelised and the veg is starting to soften, then tip into the slow cooker. Simmer the stew gently on high for 30 mins. If you want a thicker gravy, use the reduce function or leave the stew uncovered. Serve with mashed potatoes or crusty bread, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 ½kg pork tenderloin, cut into strips"},{"ingredients":"2 onions, cut into thin wedges"},{"ingredients":"4 garlic cloves, crushed"},{"ingredients":"1-2 tbsp smoked paprika"},{"ingredients":"500ml beef stock"},{"ingredients":"2 x cans chopped tomato"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp sugar"},{"ingredients":"3 peppers, chopped"},{"ingredients":"250g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"140g shredded suet"},{"ingredients":"1 ½ tsp baking powder"},{"ingredients":"small bunch oregano, most leaves chopped"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat half the oil in a large frying pan and fry the pork for 4-5 mins until browned. Once done, remove and set aside. You may need to do this in batches. Use remaining oil to fry the onions for 8-10 mins until soft and starting to brown. Then add the garlic and paprika, and cook for 1-2 mins more. Return the pork to the pan and pour in the stock, tomatoes and sugar. Bring to the boil, then turn down and simmer for 20-30 mins until the sauce has thickened."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"To make the dumplings, combine all the ingredients, apart from the unchopped oregano leaves, with enough cold water to make a scone-like dough. Roll into approximately 30 walnut-size balls. Stir the peppers into the goulash. Tuck in the dumplings, cover the pan with a lid and cook for 25-30 mins until the dumplings are puffed up. Allow to cool and freeze for up to 2 months, or serve scattered with reserved oregano and some soured cream."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"If frozen, defrost then re-heat in the microwave on medium for 4-6 mins for a single portion, and longer for larger servings or gently on the hob, covered, until piping hot."}]

recipe: Soup maker broccoli and stilton soup
name: Soup maker broccoli and stilton soup

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 each of onions and carrots, chopped"},{"ingredients":"4 sticks celery, chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp sugar"},{"ingredients":"4 garlic cloves, crushed"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp tomato purée"},{"ingredients":"2 bay leaves"},{"ingredients":"few sprigs thyme"},{"ingredients":"3 courgettes, chopped"},{"ingredients":"400g can butter beans, drained"},{"ingredients":"400g can chopped tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"1.2l vegetable stock"},{"ingredients":"100g parmesan or vegetarian equivalent, grated"},{"ingredients":"140g small pasta shapes"},{"ingredients":"small bunch basil, shredded"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Gently cook the onion, carrots and celery in the oil in a large saucepan for 20 mins, until soft. Splash in water if they stick. Add the sugar, garlic, purée, herbs and courgettes and cook for 4-5 mins on a medium heat until they brown a little."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour in the beans, tomatoes and stock, then simmer for 20 mins. If you’re freezing it, cool and do so now (freeze for up to three months). If not, add half the Parmesan and the pasta and simmer for 6-8 mins until pasta cooked. Sprinkle with basil and remaining Parmesan to serve. If frozen, defrost then re-heat before adding pasta and cheese and continuing as above."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"4 chicken leg portions, skin on"},{"ingredients":"2 red peppers , deseeded and cut into strips"},{"ingredients":"1 medium red chilli , deseeded and sliced"},{"ingredients":"glass red wine (about 175ml/6fl oz)"},{"ingredients":"½ quantity tomato sauce (see 'Goes well with')"},{"ingredients":"1-2 handfuls black olives"},{"ingredients":"chopped flatleaf parsley , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Heat the oil in a deep, ovenproof roasting pan that’s big enough to fit the chicken in a single layer. Season the chicken pieces all over, then place the pan on the hob and cook on a medium heat for 7-10 mins on each side until well browned. Scoop out the chicken with a slotted spoon and put to one side."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the peppers and chilli to the pan (there should still be plenty of fat left in it) and cook for 10 mins until soft and beginning to brown at the edges. Pour away any excess fat, then pour in the wine and stir well for 1-2 mins as it bubbles up. Tip the tomato sauce into the pan and stir again. Add a little water (up to 150ml) to achieve a thick, pouring consistency. Nestle the chicken into the sauce and scatter with the olives. Cover, bake for 30 mins, then uncover and cook for 15-20 mins more to allow the chicken to crisp up. Spoon off any fat that has risen to the surface, scatter with parsley and serve with some rice, mashed potato or polenta."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 small carrot , chopped"},{"ingredients":"400g can  plum tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"½ bunch basil , plus extra leaves, to serve"},{"ingredients":"½ recipe Multi mince (see 'Goes well with' below)"},{"ingredients":"400g spaghetti or other long pasta"},{"ingredients":"25g toasted breadcrumbs"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in non-stick frying pan. Tip in the carrot and cook for 5 mins to soften. Scoop out the tomatoes from the can and add to the pan, and cook for 5 mins more. Pour over the tomato juice and basil, then simmer for 15 mins. Whizz together in a blender until smooth. Can be frozen for up to three months."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat through with the Multi mince. Cook spaghetti according to pack instructions. Reserve some of the cooking water, drain and tip the pasta into the pan along with the sauce. Toss together, thinning with pasta water, if needed, and serve with the extra basil leaves on top and the breadcrumbs."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"3 large onions , halved and thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp dried oregano"},{"ingredients":"300g pack lean smoked back bacon , chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 x 400g cans chopped tomatoes in rich juice"},{"ingredients":"20 basil leaves , roughly torn, plus extra to serve if you like"},{"ingredients":"250g pack fresh egg lasagne (check pack for cooking instructions)"},{"ingredients":"600ml milk"},{"ingredients":"50g each butter and plain flour"},{"ingredients":"generous grating fresh nutmeg"},{"ingredients":"50g grated parmesan"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Fry the onions in the oil for about 15 mins until golden. Add the oregano and bacon and fry for 5 mins more, stirring frequently. Tip in the tomatoes, season and bubble uncovered for 5 mins. Remove from the heat and stir in the basil."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, make the white sauce. Pour the milk into a pan and tip in the butter and flour. Whisk continuously over a moderate heat to incorporate the flour, then simmer, stirring until thickened. Season with salt, pepper and nutmeg."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Spoon a third of the tomato sauce on the base of a lasagne dish. Top with a third of the lasagne sheets. Then top with a third sauce, a third lasagne, the last of the tomato sauce and finally the last sheets of lasagne. Pour over the white sauce and scatter with the cheese and an extra grating of nutmeg. Chill. If eating straight away, bake at 190C/170C fan/gas 5 for 40 mins until golden and bubbling. Scatter with basil, if you like, and serve with a salad and garlic bread."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"To freeze, cool completely, then wrap in cling film, then foil. Will store for 3 months. To serve, thaw for 6 hrs in a cool place. Unwrap and bake at 190C/170C fan/gas 5 for 50-60 mins until thoroughly heated through."}]

recipe: Honey crunch granola with almonds & apricots
name: Honey crunch granola with almonds & apricots

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"500ml chicken stock , heated"},{"ingredients":"340g jar smooth peanut butter"},{"ingredients":"2 onions , halved and thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp sunflower oil"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp finely chopped ginger"},{"ingredients":"½-1 tsp   cayenne pepper (optional)"},{"ingredients":"3 tsp ground coriander"},{"ingredients":"3 tsp ground cumin"},{"ingredients":"1-2 scotch bonnet chillies, deseeded and chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 bay leaves"},{"ingredients":"400g can  chopped tomato"},{"ingredients":"2 x 800g pack chicken thighs and drumsticks, skinned"},{"ingredients":"3 sweet potatoes , cut into chunks"},{"ingredients":"2 red peppers , deseeded and cut into chunks"},{"ingredients":"good handful  coriander , chopped, a little reserved for sprinkling"},{"ingredients":"rice and  lime wedges, to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Pour the hot stock over the peanut butter and stir until dissolved. Heat a very large pan and fry the onions in the oil for 5 mins to soften. Add the ginger, cayenne, if using, ½ tsp black pepper, coriander, cumin, chillies and bay and cook, stirring, for 2 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Tip in the tomatoes and the peanut stock, then stir in the chicken pieces. Put a lid on the pan and leave to simmer for 30 mins, stirring frequently to make sure the peanut butter doesn’t stick to the base of the pan."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Stir in the sweet potatoes, peppers and chopped coriander, then cook for 30 mins more. Serve sprinkled with the reserved coriander, with rice and lime wedges for squeezing over, if you like."}]

recipe: Chilli bean bake with soured cream mash
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 onions , chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp each ground cumin and dried thyme"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp mild chilli powder"},{"ingredients":"1kg lean minced beef"},{"ingredients":"x can chopped tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"x can kidney beans , rinsed and drained"},{"ingredients":"x can sweetcorn , drained"},{"ingredients":"3 mixed peppers , chopped into chunks"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp white or red wine vinegar"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp brown sugar"},{"ingredients":"1 beef stock cube"},{"ingredients":"1.8kg potatoes , chopped into large chunks"},{"ingredients":"300ml pot soured cream"},{"ingredients":"2x small bunches chives , snipped"},{"ingredients":"100g cheddar , grated"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Fry the onions in the oil in a large, deep saucepan until soft. Stir in the spices and cook for 2 mins, until fragrant. Crumble in the mince in batches and fry, breaking up with a wooden spoon, until all the meat is browned."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Stir in the chopped tomatoes, beans, sweetcorn, peppers, vinegar and sugar. Crumble in the stock cube, pour over 500ml water then bring to the boil. Cover and simmer for 20 mins, then uncover and simmer for 20 mins more until the mince and peppers are tender and saucy."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Meanwhile, make the mash. Boil the potatoes in lots of boiling salted water until tender, about 15 mins. Drain well, leaving in the colander to steam dry for 1 min, then tip back into the saucepan and mash with the soured cream. Season and stir in the chives."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"When the chilli mince is done, pour into 1, 2 or individual ovenproof dishes. Spoon or pipe over the mash and scatter on the cheese. Cool completely if you’re freezing any at this stage, or if you want to eat straight away, heat the oven to 220C/ 200C fan/gas 7 and bake for 25-30 mins until bubbling and golden."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 ½ tbsp cumin seed"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"3 onions , halved and thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"3 x 400g packs lean lamb mince"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp finely chopped ginger"},{"ingredients":"4 garlic cloves , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 x 400g cans chopped tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp paprika"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp ground cinnamon"},{"ingredients":"1 ½ tbsp ground coriander"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp harissa"},{"ingredients":"3 red peppers , deseeded and cut into large chunks"},{"ingredients":"2 x 400g cans chickpeas , drained"},{"ingredients":"2 x 20g packs coriander , most chopped, a few leaves left whole to serve"},{"ingredients":"500ml beef or  lamb stock , made with 2 cubes"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat your largest non-stick wok or pan, tip in the cumin seeds and toast for a few secs. Remove. Add the oil to the pan and fry the onions for 5 mins until starting to colour. Add the mince, ginger and garlic, and cook, breaking up the mince with your wooden spoon, until no longer pink. Drain any excess liquid or fat from the pan."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Stir in the tomatoes, toasted cumin, remaining spices and harissa – add more spice if you like an extra kick. Add the peppers, chickpeas, three-quarters of the chopped coriander and the stock. Cover and cook for 40 mins, stirring occasionally, until the sauce is slightly thickened. Remove from the heat. Cool, then stir in the remaining chopped coriander. Can be served or frozen at this point."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Pack into freezer bags and smooth the mince through the bag to flatten. Use within 3 months. To serve, remove from the bags and heat from frozen in a pan on the hob with a little water until bubbling hot, then scatter with coriander."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"4 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"6 smoked bacon rashers, chopped"},{"ingredients":"4 onions, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"3 carrots, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"4 celery sticks, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"8 garlic cloves, crushed"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp dried mixed herbs"},{"ingredients":"2 bay leaves"},{"ingredients":"500g mushrooms, sliced"},{"ingredients":"1½ kg lean minced beef (or use half beef, half pork mince)"},{"ingredients":"6 x 400g cans chopped tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"6 tbsp tomato purée"},{"ingredients":"large glass red wine (optional)"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp red wine vinegar"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp sugar"},{"ingredients":"parmesan, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a very large saucepan. Gently cook the bacon, onions, carrots and celery for 20 mins until golden. Add the garlic, herbs, bay and mushrooms, then cook for 2 mins more."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat a large frying pan until really hot. Crumble in just enough mince to cover the pan, cook until brown, then tip in with the veg. Continue to fry the mince in batches until used up. Tip the tomatoes and purée in with the mince and veg. Rinse the cans out with the red wine, if you have some, or with a little water, then add to the pan with the vinegar and sugar. Season generously and bring to a simmer. Simmer slowly for 1 hr until thick and saucy and the mince is tender. Serve with pasta and parmesan."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"If you want to make this in a slow cooker, visit our slow cooker bolognese recipe."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"3 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 onion, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 large garlic cloves, crushed"},{"ingredients":"¼ tsp chilli flakes"},{"ingredients":"2 rosemary sprigs, leaves finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 x 400g cans chopped tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp brown sugar"},{"ingredients":"6 pork sausages"},{"ingredients":"150ml whole milk"},{"ingredients":"1 lemon, zested"},{"ingredients":"350g rigatoni pasta"},{"ingredients":"grated parmesan and ½ small bunch parsley, leaves roughly chopped, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat 2 tbsp of the oil in a saucepan over a medium heat. Fry the onion with a pinch of salt for 7 mins. Add the garlic, chilli and rosemary, and cook for 1 min more. Tip in the tomatoes and sugar, and simmer for 20 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat the remaining oil in a medium frying pan over a medium heat. Squeeze the sausagemeat from the skins and fry, breaking it up with a wooden spoon, for 5-7 mins until golden. Add to the sauce with the milk and lemon zest, then simmer for a further 5 mins. To freeze, leave to cool completely and transfer to large freezerproof bags."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Cook the pasta following pack instructions. Drain and toss with the sauce. Scatter over the parmesan and parsley leaves to serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"250g mozzarella , drained and grated"},{"ingredients":"18-20 no cook lasagne sheets"},{"ingredients":"85g block parmesan , grated"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"4 onions , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"8 garlic cloves , crushed"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp dried mixed herbs"},{"ingredients":"2 bay leaves"},{"ingredients":"1kg minced beef"},{"ingredients":"4 x 400g/14oz cans chopped tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp ketchup"},{"ingredients":"small glass red wine (optional)"},{"ingredients":"200g butter"},{"ingredients":"140g flour"},{"ingredients":"1.7l milk"},{"ingredients":"few gratings nutmeg"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Make the meat sauce: heat the oil in a large saucepan and gently cook the onions for 10 mins until golden. Add the garlic, herbs and bay, then cook 2 mins more. Heat a large frying pan. Crumble in a quarter of the beef, cook until brown, then add to the onions. Continue to fry the beef in batches and add to the onions until all the meat is used up. Tip the tomatoes and ketchup in with the onions and beef. Rinse the cans out with the red wine, if you have some, or with a little water, then add to the pan. Season and bring to a simmer. Gently cook for 30 mins until thick and saucy, then set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, make the white sauce. Tip everything into a pan, season, then bring to a simmer, whisking continuously. Don’t worry if it’s lumpy – if you whisk enough the sauce will come together. Simmer for 5 mins, whisking, until smooth and thickened, then remove from the heat. If not using straight away, cover with cling film and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Make sure you divide everything up so that you can make two lasagnes. Place a thin layer of meat sauce in an ovenproof baking dish, drizzle with a little white sauce and scatter with a little mozzarella. Cover with a layer of lasagne sheets, then top with more of both sauces, more mozzarella and more lasagne sheets. Repeat once more, then cover the top layer of lasagne in just white sauce. Finally scatter over some Parmesan. The lasagnes can now be chilled in the fridge for a day ready to be cooked, or frozen for up to 3 months – see tips, below."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"To cook, heat oven to 200C/180C fan/ gas 6. Cook for 35-40 mins until brown on the top and crisp around the edges. Leave to settle for 10 mins before cutting into squares and serving with a green salad and some garlic bread, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"100g butter , softened, plus extra for greasing"},{"ingredients":"2 eggs"},{"ingredients":"85g caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"50g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"50g ground almonds"},{"ingredients":"zest ½ lemon"},{"ingredients":"2 portions Apple, pear & cherry compote (see 'Goes well with')"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp demerara sugar"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"First make the Apple, pear & cherry compote (see 'Goes well with'). You'll need 2 of the 12 portions of compote for this cake."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4 and grease a 20cm cake tin. Beat together the butter, eggs, caster sugar, flour, almonds and lemon zest to a smooth mixture. Scrape into the tin, dollop over the compote, then bake for 25-30 mins until well risen. Scatter over the sugar and return to the oven for 10-15 mins until the cake is cooked through."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Remove from the tin and eat warm or at room temperature with cream or custard."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"500g pack beef skirt or chuck steak, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 onions , chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 medium potatoes , halved lengthways and sliced"},{"ingredients":"250g swede , diced"},{"ingredients":"8 tbsp pickle"},{"ingredients":"200g butter , diced"},{"ingredients":"100g lard , diced"},{"ingredients":"600g plain flour , plus extra for dusting"},{"ingredients":"1 large egg , beaten with 2 tbsp milk"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"To make the pastry, rub the butter, lard and 1 tsp salt into the flour with your fingertips, or mix in a food processor. Blend in 8 tbsp cold water to make a firm dough. Cut into 8, cover with cling film and chill for 20 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat oven to 220C/200C fan/gas 7. Mix together the beef, onions, potatoes, swede, 1 tbsp black pepper and 1 tsp salt. Roll out each piece of dough on a lightly floured surface to make a round about 20cm across. Use a plate or base of a cake tin to trim the shape."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Pack an eighth of the beef mixture down the centre of each pastry round, leaving a margin at each end, then top with a good spoonful of pickle. Brush all round the edges of the pastry with some of the beaten egg, then carefully draw up the pastry on each side so that it meets at the top, and pinch together to seal."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Lift the pasties onto 2 non-stick baking sheets, brush with egg and bake for 10 mins. Then reduce oven to 180C/ 160C fan/gas 4 and bake for a further 45-55 mins until golden."}]

recipe: Vietnamese lamb shanks with sweet potatoes
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp groundnut oil"},{"ingredients":"4 lamb shanks , about 350g each"},{"ingredients":"2 onions , halved and cut into half moons"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp finely chopped fresh root ginger"},{"ingredients":"3 garlic cloves , finely sliced"},{"ingredients":"2 red chillies , both deseeded, one chopped and one thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp soft brown sugar , plus 1 tsp"},{"ingredients":"3 star anise"},{"ingredients":"2 lemongrass  stalks, tough outer leaves removed, then bruised"},{"ingredients":"1.2l lamb stock"},{"ingredients":"1 ½ tbsp tomato purée"},{"ingredients":"4 sweet potatoes , peeled and cut into big chunks"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp fish sauce"},{"ingredients":"juice 2 limes"},{"ingredients":"big handful mint  leaves, torn"},{"ingredients":"handful basil leaves"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 160C/140C fan/gas 3. Heat 1 tbsp oil in a heavy-bottomed casserole, season the shanks, then brown them 2 at a time on all sides, adding the remaining oil for the second batch. Remove the lamb and add the onions. Fry them quite briskly, about 30 secs, add the ginger, garlic and chopped chilli, then turn the heat down and cook for 1 min. Add 1 tbsp sugar, stir, then add the star anise, lemongrass, stock, purée and seasoning. Bring to the boil."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Cover and cook in the oven for 1½ hrs, then add the sweet potatoes and cook for 1 hr more. The lamb should be completely tender and almost falling off the bones. Stir in the fish sauce, lime juice and 1 tsp sugar to just lift the flavour, then scatter with the mint, basil and the sliced chilli to serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp balsamic vinegar"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp concentrated liquid beef stock"},{"ingredients":"3 garlic cloves , finely grated"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp wholegrain mustard"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp clear honey"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil , plus extra for brushing"},{"ingredients":"6 sirloin steaks , about 5cm thick"},{"ingredients":"salad or peas, to serve (optional)"},{"ingredients":"1 ½kg medium potato , such as King Edward, cut into wedges"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp sunflower oil , plus extra for greasing"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp thyme leaf"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp green peppercorn , crushed"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Mix together the vinegar, stock, garlic, mustard, honey and olive oil in a large shallow bowl, then grind in some black pepper, but no salt. Add the steaks and turn to coat. Leave to marinate in the fridge for 1 hr, or preferably overnight."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Toss the potatoes in a large bowl with the oil, thyme and peppercorns. Spread out on 2 greased baking sheets and bake for 10-15 mins until the potatoes are nearly cooked. Remove and leave to go cold."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Open-freeze the wedges until solid, then pack into a large rigid container in layers, interleaving with foil. Individually pack the steaks into freezer bags – make sure they lay completely flat when you put them in the freezer. Use within 1 month."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"To serve, heat oven to 220C/200C fan/ gas 7, with a baking tray inside to warm up for the steaks. Put the wedges on another large baking tray, spread them apart and season. Bake for 20 mins until golden and crisp. Unwrap the steaks and brush both sides with oil. Press onto the hot tray and bake for 15-25 mins, turning after 10 mins and testing until hot, to give you medium-rare steak. Serve with the wedges and salad or peas, if you like."}]

recipe: Vietnamese lamb shanks with sweet potatoes
name: Vietnamese lamb shanks with sweet potatoes

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1.4kg chicken"},{"ingredients":"1 each carrot , onion and celery stick"},{"ingredients":"50g butter"},{"ingredients":"2 leeks sliced"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp plain flour"},{"ingredients":"grated zest 1 lemon"},{"ingredients":"large bunch parsley chopped"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp crème fraîche"},{"ingredients":"250g ready-made puff pastry"},{"ingredients":"beaten egg or milk, to glaze"},{"ingredients":"bouquet garni  (see 'Try', below)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the chicken in a pan, which is large enough to take it snugly. Roughly chop the carrot, onion and celery and tuck around the chicken with the bouquet garni. Pour in enough water to come just over halfway up the chicken, then season with salt and pepper."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat, cover tightly and simmer gently for 1-1¼ hrs, until the chicken is well cooked. Carefully lift the chicken out onto a board lined with kitchen paper to absorb any stock that leaks out. Then strain the stock, discarding the veggies, and measure 500ml into a jug – any extra you can cool and freeze for another time."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Heat the oven to 200C/fan 180C/gas 6. Strip the meat from the chicken, discarding the skin and bones. Cut the meat into large chunks and put into a 1-litre pie dish."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Melt the butter in a pan, add the leeks and fry until starting to soften. Sift in the flour and cook for 1 min. Gradually stir in the stock, cooking until the sauce is smooth and glossy. Take off the heat and add lemon, parsley and crème fraîche. Season. Pour the sauce over the chicken and leave to cool."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Roll out the pastry and trim to 5cm larger than the pie dish. Brush the edge of the dish with water. Lay the pastry on the pie, tucking the edges under to make a double layer around the rim. Press the pastry edge to seal it. Roll out any trimmings to make leaves for the top. Brush the pastry with milk or egg and bake for 30-35 mins until the pastry is golden."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"850ml low-salt chicken or vegetable stock"},{"ingredients":"100g pearl barley"},{"ingredients":"750g new potato , sliced"},{"ingredients":"½ spring green cabbage , shredded"},{"ingredients":"140g frozen broad or soya beans"},{"ingredients":"100g frozen pea"},{"ingredients":"250g broccoli florets"},{"ingredients":"200g tub crème fraîche"},{"ingredients":"small bunch dill , snipped"},{"ingredients":"zest 1 lemon , plus squeeze of juice"},{"ingredients":"600g cooked, peeled prawn"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Bring the stock to a simmer in a large frying pan or shallow casserole covered with a lid. Add the pearl barley, cover and cook for 10 mins. Then add the potatoes and cook covered for 12-15 mins until tender."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Remove the lid, increase the heat and bubble the stock for a few mins to reduce. Stir in the greens, crème fraîche, dill, zest and juice. If you’re freezing, cool at this stage. If eating straight away, simmer for 3-4 mins until veg is just tender."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Just before serving, stir in the prawns to heat through and season to taste. If freezing, cool completely then scatter the prawns on top and freeze. Defrost fully in the fridge overnight then gently bring back to a simmer, uncovered, until veg is tender and prawns hot through."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1kg lean minced beef"},{"ingredients":"2 back bacon  rashers, chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 onions , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"150ml red wine"},{"ingredients":"500ml beef stock  (from a cube is fine)"},{"ingredients":"leaves from 3 sprigs thyme"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the olive oil in a non-stick frying pan. When hot, tip in the mince and cook for 10 mins until browned all over, breaking up any lumps with the back of a spoon. Tip onto a plate. You may need to do this in batches."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the bacon to the pan with the onions and garlic, then cook for 7 mins until the bacon is cooked and onion softened. Return the mince to the pan, then pour in the red wine, stock and thyme leaves. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 30 mins until the mince is tender and the sauce has reduced down. Once cool, can be frozen for up to 3 months."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"8 eating apples , peeled, cored and cut into chunks"},{"ingredients":"4 medium Bramley apples , peeled, cored and cut into chunks"},{"ingredients":"8 firm pears , peeled, cored and thickly sliced"},{"ingredients":"6 tbsp sugar , or to taste"},{"ingredients":"280g dried sour cherries (or dried cranberries)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the apples and pears in a pan with the sugar and 50ml water. Bring to a simmer, then gently cook, covered, for 15 mins or so until the Bramley apple has collapsed to a purée and the eating apple and pear are tender (stir to make sure it doesn’t catch on the bottom)."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Stir in the cherries or cranberries for 1 min, taste and add a little more sugar if necessary. Can be chilled for 3-5 days. Serve with vanilla ice cream, if you like. See 'Goes well with' for ideas for using up the compote."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1½kg potato, chopped into chunks"},{"ingredients":"50g butter"},{"ingredients":"1½l full-fat milk"},{"ingredients":"800g skinless white fish"},{"ingredients":"600g skinless smoked haddock fillet"},{"ingredients":"1 onion, quartered"},{"ingredients":"2 bay leaves"},{"ingredients":"140g butter"},{"ingredients":"140g plain flour"},{"ingredients":"nutmeg, to season"},{"ingredients":"small bunch parsley, leaves only, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"200g cooked, peeled prawns"},{"ingredients":"6 eggs, hard-boiled and quartered (just 3 eggs if you are freezing one of the pies, as the eggs can't be frozen)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Simmer the potatoes for about 20 mins until tender, then drain and mash with most of the butter, plenty of seasoning and a little milk. Season and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, cut the fish into 2cm cubes. Bring the milk just to a simmer in a large frying pan – when you see a few small bubbles, add the fish, onion and bay leaves, then cover and cook for 6-8 mins. Lift the fish out onto a plate and strain the milk into a jug."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Melt the butter in a pan, stir in the flour and cook for 1 min over a medium heat. Take off the heat, pour in a little poaching milk, then stir until blended. Continue to add the milk gradually, mixing well until you have a smooth sauce. Return to the heat, bring to the boil, then simmer for 5 mins, stirring continuously, until it coats the back of a spoon. Remove from the heat, season with salt, pepper and nutmeg, then mix in the parsley."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Divide the fish between 2 ovenproof dishes, about 1.3 litres each and strain any juices into the sauce. Scatter over the prawns, then add the eggs to both dishes if eating straightaway, or to just one dish if freezing the other. Pour the sauce over both. Spoon half of the mash over one dish so it covers everything, making sure it reaches the sides. Rough up the top with a fork and dot with remaining butter. Bake for 30 mins until the top is golden. Freeze the remaining fish and mash (see tips, below)."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 ½kg whole chicken"},{"ingredients":"2 onions , 1 quartered, 1 chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 carrots , 1 cut into 3-4 chunks, 1 finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 thick slices ginger"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves , crushed"},{"ingredients":"small bunch parsley or coriander, leaves picked and chopped, stalks left whole"},{"ingredients":"50g butter"},{"ingredients":"vegetable oil or rapeseed oil, for frying"},{"ingredients":"50g flour"},{"ingredients":"2-3 tbsp mild curry paste , such as korma or tikka"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp ground turmeric"},{"ingredients":"1 chicken stock cube"},{"ingredients":"150ml double cream"},{"ingredients":"6 sheets filo pastry"},{"ingredients":"A little melted butter or oil"},{"ingredients":"Tenderstem broccoli , if you like"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the chicken, quartered onion, carrot chunks, ginger, garlic and herb stalks in a large stock pot. Cover the chicken completely with water, bring to a simmer, then turn down the heat, cover and cook gently for 1 hr. Turn the chicken over halfway through cooking and top up the water if you need to. After 1 hr the chicken should be tender – try pulling a leg away from the breast with some tongs. If there’s much resistance, keep cooking, checking every 10 mins or so. Carefully remove the chicken from the cooking liquid and leave to cool on a plate for about 10 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Shred the chicken meat and discard the fat and bones. Strain the cooking liquid (this is your stock) and discard the onions, carrots and other bits (or keep them to make soup). Measure out 500ml of the stock."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Melt the butter in a pan (use the stock pan if it’s empty – you don’t need to wash it). Add a drizzle of oil and the chopped onion and carrot. Cook until the veg is soft, for about 8-10 mins. Stir in the flour, curry paste and turmeric, then crumble in the stock cube. As you stir, the ingredients will clump together. Keep cooking for a min or so, then add a ladleful of the chicken cooking liquid. Stir well until smooth, then add another ladleful. Continue until all of the stock has been used up and you have a smooth sauce."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Stir the chicken, cream and chopped herbs into the sauce, then season well and remove from the heat. If freezing portions at this stage, transfer to a sealable container or bag, cool, then freeze for up to two months. Defrost thoroughly in the fridge before reheating in a pan or the microwave. See tips below for serving suggestions."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/ gas 4. Transfer the creamy curried chicken to a pie dish, about 25 x 5cm. Brush 6 sheets filo pastry with a little melted butter or oil and scrunch the sheets on top of the pie, covering the filling. Bake the pie for about 45-50 mins, until the top is crisp and the curried chicken is bubbling and hot. Serve with Tenderstem broccoli, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"500g slim young  leek , thickly sliced"},{"ingredients":"300g broccoli , cut into small florets"},{"ingredients":"3 celery sticks, de-stringed and sliced"},{"ingredients":"1 ½kg floury potato , such as King Edward, cut into even-sized chunks"},{"ingredients":"85g butter"},{"ingredients":"170g pot 0% fat Greek yogurt"},{"ingredients":"850ml semi-skimmed milk"},{"ingredients":"75g plain flour"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp English mustard"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp wholegrain mustard"},{"ingredients":"300g pack mature cheddar , finely grated"},{"ingredients":"handful frozen peas"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Bring a large pan of salted water to the boil. Put the leeks, broccoli and celery in a large steamer. Add the potatoes to the water and cook for 20 mins, with the vegetables steaming on top, until all are tender. Drain the potatoes, then mash with plenty of seasoning, 25g of the butter and all the yogurt."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"While the veg cooks, pour the milk into a pan, add the flour, both mustards and remaining butter, and cook over a medium heat, whisking all the time, until smooth and thickened. Stir in half the cheese and season. Remove from heat."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Divide the steamed veg and peas between 8 individual pie dishes. Pour over the sauce and top with the mash, then sprinkle over the remaining cheese."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Pack into freezer bags and use within 3 months. To serve, unwrap and put the dishes on a baking tray in the cold oven, then set to 200C/180C fan/ gas 6. Bake for 50-55 mins until bubbling and hot all the way through."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"700g floury potatoes , sliced"},{"ingredients":"25g butter"},{"ingredients":"50g grated parmesan"},{"ingredients":"140g pancetta or streaky bacon, cut into strips"},{"ingredients":"2 oregano sprigs, leaves stripped, or 2 tsp dried oregano"},{"ingredients":"½ quantity beef with red wine & carrots (see 'Goes well with')"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"First make the Beef with red wine & carrots (see 'Goes well with'). You will need half the finished stew for this recipe."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat oven to 220C/200C fan/gas 7. Cook the potatoes in boiling, salted water for 10 mins until almost done. Drain well, then mix with the butter and half the Parmesan."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"In a large saucepan, fry the pancetta or bacon until golden. Stir in the fresh oregano leaves or dried oregano, then add the beef stew and heat through. Tip into an ovenproof dish and top with the cheesy potatoes, overlapping. Sprinkle with the remaining Parmesan and bake for 20 mins until golden and crisp on top. Serve with a green salad."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"4 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 onions, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 carrots, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 celery sticks, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves, crushed"},{"ingredients":"2 bay leaves"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp sugar"},{"ingredients":"4 x 400g/14oz cans chopped tomatoes"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a pan and add the vegetables and bay leaf. Stir in the sugar with some salt. Gently cook for 10-15 mins until the veg is tender. Stir in the tomatoes and 150ml water. Simmer very gently for 30 mins until the sauce has reduced by two-thirds and is very thick. (If you have doubled or tripled the quantities, this may take up to 1 hr.)"},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Stir occasionally, particularly towards the end of the cooking time, so that the sauce doesn’t catch on the bottom. If you like your sauce a little thinner, add a splash of water. Serve half with pasta and chill or freeze other half in 1-2 batches for later use (see 'Goes well with' for ideas of how to use up your sauce)."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"8 large sausages (course-cut ones like Toulouse or Cumberland are ideal)"},{"ingredients":"¼ quantity tomato sauce (see 'Goes well with')"},{"ingredients":"3 x 400g/14oz cans butter beans"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp black treacle or muscovado sugar"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp English mustard"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"In a large casserole, fry the sausages until brown all over – about 10 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the tomato sauce, stirring well, then stir in the beans, treacle or sugar and mustard. Bring to the simmer, cover and cook for 30 mins. Great served with crusty bread or rice."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"vegetable or sunflower oil , for frying"},{"ingredients":"1 ½kg shin of beef or stewing beef, cut into cubes"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp flour"},{"ingredients":"2 large  onions, sliced"},{"ingredients":"600g carrots, cut into batons"},{"ingredients":"4 garlic cloves, crushed"},{"ingredients":"glass red wine (about 175ml/6fl oz)"},{"ingredients":"850ml beef stock"},{"ingredients":"3 bay leaves"},{"ingredients":"few  thyme sprigs"},{"ingredients":"jacket potatoes or mash, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large frying pan. Put the beef in a bowl, sprinkle with the flour and seasoning, then mix until well coated. Fry in batches, adding more oil if necessary, until everything is well browned. Transfer to a casserole dish."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add another tbsp oil to the pan and stir in the onion and carrots. Cover and gently cook for 10-12 mins until softened, then remove the lid and cook until just beginning to brown. Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 min more. Pour in the wine and stir well, letting it boil up for 1 min, then pour the whole mixture over the meat. Add the stock, bay leaves and thyme, bring to a simmer, then cover and gently simmer for 2½ hrs until the meat is very tender. If the sauce looks a bit thin, remove the lid and continue to cook until it thickens. Eat half now; chill or freeze the rest for later (see 'Goes well with' for ideas on using the rest of the stew)."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1l milk"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves , bashed"},{"ingredients":"2 bay leaves"},{"ingredients":"500g dried pasta"},{"ingredients":"350g broccoli , in small florets"},{"ingredients":"75g butter"},{"ingredients":"75g plain flour"},{"ingredients":"a little freshly grated nutmeg"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp mustard powder"},{"ingredients":"small bunch parsley , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"200g cheese , grated (cheddar, Parmesan, Gruyère, or a mixture)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Bring the milk, garlic and bay leaves to the boil in a small saucepan, then remove from the heat and leave to infuse. Cook the pasta to al dente following pack instructions (if you’re freezing, cook for 1 min less), adding the broccoli for the final 2 mins. Drain."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Strain the milk into a jug. Heat the butter in the pan until foaming then stir in the flour for 1 min. Add the milk a little at a time, stirring or whisking constantly to remove any lumps. Bubble for 1-2 mins, stirring constantly until you have a thick, lump-free sauce."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Remove from the heat and stir in some nutmeg, the mustard powder, parsley, three-quarters of the cheese and seasoning. Combine with the pasta and broccoli and transfer to one large, or individual, heatproof dishes. Scatter over the remaining cheese and cool and freeze for up to three months, or heat the grill to high and cook for 2-3 mins until golden and bubbling. If frozen, defrost in the fridge overnight, then cook at 200C/180C fan/gas 6 for 30-40 mins until piping hot."}]

recipe: Cheese & spinach penne with walnut crumble
name: Cheese & spinach penne with walnut crumble

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 aubergines , cubed"},{"ingredients":"6 garlic cloves , sliced"},{"ingredients":"family pack mixed peppers (5 total), deseeded and cut into large chunks"},{"ingredients":"3 large  courgettes , cut into chunky batons"},{"ingredients":"680g bottle passata"},{"ingredients":"300ml vegetable stock"},{"ingredients":"small handful basil leaves , most chopped, a few leaves left whole to serve"},{"ingredients":"125g tub garlic cream cheese (we used Boursin Light)"},{"ingredients":"100g low-fat cream cheese"},{"ingredients":"40g fresh  breadcrumb"},{"ingredients":"40g pine nut , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"8 skinless  salmon fillets"},{"ingredients":"crusty bread , to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large non-stick wok or pan, add the aubergines and cook for 5 mins, stirring, until starting to soften and brown. Add the garlic and stir for a few secs. Tip in the peppers, courgettes, passata, stock and half the chopped basil. Season, cover and cook for 20 mins, stirring occasionally, until the veg is just tender. Cool, stir in the remaining basil and spoon into 8 x 250ml shallow ovenproof dishes or foil containers."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"For the salmon, beat together the cheeses. Mix the breadcrumbs and pine nuts on a plate. Spread the top of the fish fillets with the cheese mix, then dip in the nutty crumbs to coat the cheese. Put a fillet on top of each ratatouille-filled dish."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Put the dishes inside freezer bags and seal. Use within 6 weeks. To serve, unwrap the dishes, put on a baking tray in a cold oven, then set to 200C/180C fan/ gas 6. Bake for 55 mins until bubbling and the fish is cooked. Check after 30 mins – if the crumbs are getting too brown, cover the fish with foil. Serve scattered with basil, with bread, if you like."}]

recipe: Cheese & spinach penne with walnut crumble
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"500g pack  penne"},{"ingredients":"2 large  leeks , sliced"},{"ingredients":"85g butter"},{"ingredients":"85g plain flour"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp ready-made English mustard"},{"ingredients":"good grating  nutmeg"},{"ingredients":"1l milk , plus a bit extra"},{"ingredients":"350g pack  mature cheddar , grated"},{"ingredients":"4 slices French bread , diced"},{"ingredients":"85g walnut piece"},{"ingredients":"400g bag spinach"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"If you are eating one of the pasta bakes now, heat oven to 190C/170C fan/ gas 5. Boil the pasta with the leeks for 10 mins, then drain."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, put the butter, flour, mustard, nutmeg and milk in a large pan with some seasoning. Gently heat, stirring all the time, until bubbling and thickened, then cook for 2 mins more, stirring frequently. Remove from the heat and stir in two-thirds of the cheese. Toss the remaining cheese with the bread and walnuts."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Cook the spinach in the microwave, or pour a kettle of boiling water over it to wilt, then squeeze out the excess water. Stir into the sauce with the pasta, leeks and some seasoning. If necessary, add a little extra milk to loosen. Divide between 2 ovenproof dishes and scatter the bread mixture on top. If eating straight away, bake for 40 mins until golden, or cool to freeze."}]

recipe: Soup maker broccoli and stilton soup
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 onion , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 celery stick, sliced"},{"ingredients":"1 leek , sliced"},{"ingredients":"1 medium potato , diced"},{"ingredients":"750ml low salt or homemade chicken or vegetable stock"},{"ingredients":"1 head broccoli , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"140g stilton , or other blue cheese, crumbled"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put all the ingredients into the soup maker, except the stilton, and press the ‘smooth soup’ function. Make sure you don’t fill the soup maker above the max fill line."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Once the cycle is complete, season, and stir in most of the stilton. Blend briefly again until the cheese has melted into the soup. Season with more black pepper and top with the reserved cheese to serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"3 x 200g/7oz white chocolate bars, chopped"},{"ingredients":"200g butter"},{"ingredients":"2 eggs"},{"ingredients":"100g light  muscovado sugar"},{"ingredients":"175g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp vanilla extract"},{"ingredients":"350g plain flour"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp baking powder"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp cinnamon"},{"ingredients":"100g dried cranberry"},{"ingredients":"100g macadamia nut , chopped"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Melt 170g of the chocolate, then allow to cool. Beat in the butter, eggs, sugars and vanilla, preferably with an electric hand whisk, until creamy. Stir in the flour, baking powder, cinnamon and cranberries with two-thirds of the remaining chocolate and macadamias, to make a stiff dough."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Using a tablespoon measure or a small ice-cream scoop, drop small mounds onto a large baking dish, spacing them well apart, then poke in the reserved chocolate, nuts and berries. Bake in batches for 12 mins until pale golden, leave to harden for 1-2 mins, then cool on a wire rack."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"To freeze, open-freeze the raw cookie dough scoops on baking trays; when solid, pack them into a freezer container, interleaving the layers with baking parchment. Use within 3 months. Bake from frozen for 15-20 mins."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"3 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"16 chicken pieces on the bone (about 3kg/6lb 8oz in total)"},{"ingredients":"140g smoked bacon, chopped or lardons or cubetti di pancetta"},{"ingredients":"4 medium carrots, thickly sliced"},{"ingredients":"2 onions, roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp plain flour"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp tomato purée"},{"ingredients":"75ml white wine or cider vinegar"},{"ingredients":"1l chicken stock"},{"ingredients":"2 bay leaves"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp double cream or crème fraîche"},{"ingredients":"600g small new potatoes, halved"},{"ingredients":"12 large white mushrooms, quartered"},{"ingredients":"chopped herbs, such as parsley, tarragon or chives"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Heat the oil in a large flameproof casserole with a lid. Fry the chicken pieces in batches for 5 mins on each side until well browned, then transfer to a plate. Sizzle the bacon in the casserole for a few mins until beginning to crisp. Stir in the carrots and onions, then cook for 5 mins until starting to soften. Stir in the flour and tomato purée and cook for 1 min more. Finally, splash in the vinegar and stir well."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour in the stock and bring to a simmer. Add the bay, cream and seasoning. Slide in the chicken pieces and scatter over the potatoes, turning everything over a few times so that the potatoes are immersed in the sauce. Put the lid on and place in the oven. After 40 mins, remove from the oven and stir in the mushrooms. Cover again and cook in the oven for 10 mins more until the chicken is cooked through and tender but not completely falling off the bone. You can now turn off the heat, and chill and freeze some or all of it (see freezing tips, below). If eating straight away, cook for 10 mins more, then sprinkle over the herbs and serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"100g pack mushrooms, halve them if large"},{"ingredients":"1tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1tbsp plain flour"},{"ingredients":"½ recipe Multi mince  (see link below)"},{"ingredients":"750g potatoes, quartered"},{"ingredients":"75ml buttermilk or skimmed milk"},{"ingredients":"2 spring onions, thinly sliced"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Tip the mushrooms into a pan with the oil and cook for 5 mins until browned. Mix in the flour, then add the Multi mince. Cook until heated through and the sauce is slightly thickened, then tip the mixture into a medium-sized ovenproof dish. Heat oven to 220C/fan 200C/gas 7."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, cook the potatoes in a large pan of boiling salted water for 15 mins until soft. Drain and mash with the buttermilk, then stir in half the spring onions. Spoon over the mince and fluff up. Cook in the oven for 15 mins until the top is lightly browned. Serve sprinkled with spring onions."}]

recipe: Cinnamon pancakes with compote & maple syrup
name: Cinnamon pancakes with compote & maple syrup
